metadata.title: CVE-2020-11061 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
In Bareos Director less than or equal to 16.2.10, 17.2.9, 18.2.8, and 19.2.7, a heap overflow allows a malicious client to corrupt the director's memory via oversized digest strings sent during initialization of a verify job. Disabling verify jobs mitigates the problem. This issue is also patched in Bareos versions 19.2.8, 18.2.9 and 17.2.10.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-11061` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bacula - 9.6.5-2
bacula-bscan - 9.6.5-2
bacula-client - 9.6.5-2
bacula-common - 9.6.5-2
bacula-common-mysql - 9.6.5-2
bacula-common-pgsql - 9.6.5-2
bacula-common-sqlite3 - 9.6.5-2
bacula-console - 9.6.5-2
bacula-console-qt - 9.6.5-2
bacula-director - 9.6.5-2
bacula-director-mysql - 9.6.5-2
bacula-director-pgsql - 9.6.5-2
bacula-director-sqlite3 - 9.6.5-2
bacula-fd - 9.6.5-2
bacula-sd - 9.6.5-2
bacula-server - 9.6.5-2
bacula-tray-monitor - 9.6.5-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bacula package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.6.5-2').
